material.mattext:
Male's height (X) follows (approximately) a normal distribution with mean of 69 inches and standard deviation 2.8. Using Excel find: (a) What proportion of males are less than 65 inches tall? (What is P(X < 65)?) (b) What proportion of males are more than 75 inches tall? (What is P(X > 75)?) (c) What proportion of males are between 66 and 72 inches tall? (What is
P(66 < X < 72)?)

(a) Excel provides: Normal with mean = 69 and standard deviation = 2.8 x z-score P(X ≤ x) 65 −1.42857 0.076564
So roughly 7.65% of males are less than 65 inches tall.
(b) Excel provides: Normal with mean = 69 and standard deviation = 2.8
x z-score P(X ≤ x) 75 2.142857 0.983938
P(X > 75) = 1 − 0.983938 = 0.016062 and so roughly 1.6% of males are more than 75 inches tall. (c) Excel provides:
Normal with mean = 69 and standard deviation = 2.8
x z-score P(X ≤ x) 66 −1.07143 0.141988
x z-score P(X ≤ x) 72 1.071429 0.858012
and therefore P(66 < X < 72) = 0.858012 − 0.141988 = 0.716024 Roughly 71.6% of males are between 66 and 72 inches tall.
